intro: Triumfetta welwitschii var. deschampsii, commonly known as the white-flowered triumfetta, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It features small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
